summary: We examined 2018 enrollment in Affordable Care Act health insurance exchanges and federal efforts to encourage enrollment. We found: About 8.7 million people bought insurance in 2018 through the federal website (healthcare.gov), 5% less than in 2017. Health and Human Services reduced its advertising and other consumer outreach. The 23 stakeholders we interviewed had mixed views about the effects of these reductions on enrollment. HHS...
title: Health Insurance Exchanges: HHS Should Enhance Its Management of Open Enrollment Performance
